title: session takeover via open protocol redirection on streamlabs.com

profile.name: Logitech
profile.about: Logitech is a consumer electronics manufacturer, specialising in smart home and video collaboration equipment, gaming accessories and peripherals

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
Hi Logitech team, on streamlabs.com the endpoint: `streamlabs.com/global/identity?popup=1&r=protocol://merch.streamlabs.com` redirect any authenticated user to a arbitrary protocol, and it merge the redirect link with an access_token.

{F1281409}

this means that if a malicious app that handle the protocol is installed on the device the access token will be steal by this app and consequently a session takeover is possible on multiple streamlabs domain 

## Steps To Reproduce:


  1. once authenticated on streamlabs.com go to: streamlabs.com/global/identity?popup=1&r=test://merch.streamlabs.com and intercept the request in burp.
  2. grab the redirection link in the response(as a malicious app can do, especially on mobile systems), change the protocol to https and open it in a private browser window
  3. finally in the private browser window go to: https://merch.streamlabs.com/ or https://streamlabs.com/<your_store_name> or https://streamlabs.com/my-portal?origin=cs

in every case you will be logged in as the victim

{F1281408}

{F1281407}

##possible fix

implement a protocol check on the redirection in this endpoint

## Supporting Material/References:

i attached 3 images

## Impact

session takeover by  malicious apps(on mobile systems, it's more common)

activities.message:
Hi, here is a short video. 

First of all I installed the malicious app that registered the scheme "test://streamlabs.com" in the OS.
 
Loading the url ```https://streamlabs.com/global/identity?popup=1&r=test://streamlabs.com``` the app is launched and the url with the token displayed. (The malicious app is very simple so it works with "hot loading" of the deep link) 

Here attached you can find also the apk 

Note that the ```auth``` parameter is false because actually I was not logged in

Hi @f_m,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@sodacan

Hi @sodacan, thanks for the response.
Basically the android deep link protection apply only with HTTP / HTTPS protocol,if there is any protocol redirection  with sensitive token on the domain is responsability of the website owner to not allow that.otherwise a malicious app can steal the access token. 
If you have any doubt tell me.

Thanks f_m
The vulnerable request is from the redirect i talk initially. A protocol redirection basically
Thank you :)

Hi @sodacan, I don't want to be apprehensive, but there is any news? the logitech team have validated this one?

thanks @f_m

Hi  @f_m , There are no updates yet. As soon as there is news to share we will let you know.
@sodacan

hey @sodacan , this seems fixed now, the endpoint isn't working anymore.
will this be triaged?
@logi_aron, @logi_harsha?
Hi @f_m, thank you for creating this report. It was fixed on Friday and I have been running tests to make sure everything is alright. Thank you for confirming on your end as well.

Hi @logi_anfal, thank you for the response. I would like to share a thing that I learned from that issue. In this issue even a website can perform the attack by register the schema in the browser https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/registerProtocolHandler 
P. S. could you triage this one, just for reputation purpose? :)

Thank you f_m
Thank you for the bounty. :)
Thanks!

@logi_aron thanks again for the reward,
since it's a very strange one i would like to disclose it if possible.

@logi_anfal is ok for you to disclose this one? if not, no problem, i would just know it.

thanks
